Crop Production Service

                                                          West Isle Production

                                                             3201 Avenue 54

                                                           Alpaugh, CA 93201

                                                             Tulare County



                                                           Revised July 2014



                                                           EXECUTIVE SUMMARY





Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The employees of Crop Production Service, West Isle Production (West Isle Production), 3201 Avenue 54, Alpaugh, California, are committed to the prevention of a release of Anhydrous Ammonia that is stored and handled at the facility. West Isle Production has developed a management system for the RMP program, has performed a Process Hazard Analysis, developed prevention program elements and formulated an emergency response plan. If an accidental release should occur, the facility will work with the local fire department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment. The emergency response plan has been developed and would be implemented in the event of a release.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

The following activities occur at the facility:

a.    Blending and storage of mixed grade fertilizers for use as crop production nutrients (NAICS Code 24491 Farm Supplies - Wholesale).

b.    The production of Ammonium Polyphosphate (NAICS Code 325311 - Nitrogenous Fertilizer Manufacturing). and Zinc Chelate fertilizers 

c.    Receiving and storage of Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS Number 7664-41-7). Anhydrous Ammonia is received by bulk tanker truck and stored in two 30,000-gallon capacity aboveground storage tanks.



Accidental Release Prevention Program 

West Isle Production has compreh

ensive written programs and procedures to comply with the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) and California Accidental Release Program (CalARP) regulations. Facility management and employees involved in the covered process are trained and aware of their responsibilities to implement the RMP/CalARP Program requirements.



Five-Year Accident History 

In the past 5 years, there has been no release of Anhydrous Ammonia that has caused any deaths, injuries or property damage at the facility nor resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage or environmental damage.



The Emergency Response Program

The facility has incorporated provisions of the following regulations in their emergency plan:

?    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.38

?    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120

?    Section 25503, Division 6



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety is an on-going process at this facility. Inspections and audits are conducted periodically to determine how well the facility is in compliance with regulatory and company requirements. At the time of this update, there were two risk reduction measures being considered for implementation by facility management.
